page.title: 02POSTAL DELIVERIES
page.content: {Country }or {Rural postmen}normally work from a village Post Office and do deliveries on a bike or in a van.The Failand,Abbot and Leighwoods areas are an exception to this, these areas are delivered from Clifton delivery office by postmen driving vans.Long Ashton is delivered to by postmen working from the local P.O.some on foot and some on bikes.{ {Rural Postmen} also differ from town postmen because they deliver parcels as well as letters.They sell stamps and postal orders and they accept parcels for posting.The postman who delivers to Failand starts work at 05.30am and has to sort the letters for his own delivery into a delivery order before going out to deliver them.After completing their rounds they have to make a collection from the local Post boxes.
